English.Text: They refuse. Clearly the fear of divine retribution against those who defy royalty is too strong. They call out to the rest of the pickers, who stand shoulder-to-shoulder with them in case you should want to take things any further. You turn miserably back to the carriage in the road, and it is only after hours of hopeful meandering in this beautiful country that you recall Sir Archibald's briefing, "despite her secrecy, a Queen never travels humbly." Of course, how stupid! One of the countless castles that dominate the hills all around. It is just a question of exactly which of her landed relatives she came here to visit...
